definition: Sun Tzu, also known as Sun Wu 孫武|孙武[Sun1 Wu3] (c. 500 BC, dates of birth and death uncertain), general, strategist and philosopher of the Spring and Autumn Period (700-475 BC), believed to be the author of the “Art of War” 孫子兵法|孙子兵法[Sun1 zi3 Bing1 fa3], one of the Seven Military Classics of ancient China 武經七書|武经七书[Wu3 jing1 Qi1 shu1]

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
“Art of War”, one of the Seven Military Classics of ancient China 武經七書|武经七书[Wu3 jing1 Qi1 shu1], written by Sun Tzu 孫子|孙子[Sun1 zi3]

sentences.english: I delightedly hugged and greeted my grandchildren.
sentences.chinese: 我愉快地擁抱了我的孫子孫女，和他們打招呼。

sentences.english: Son of man KongZhu dream Dan by other seduce, woke up very worried.
sentences.chinese: 孫子夢到丹孔珠被別的男人勾引，醒來之後非常擔憂。

sentences.english: Now I, his coddled son, get to dick around on the Internet all day.
sentences.chinese: 現在，他溺愛的孫子，我，才得以網絡上混口飯喫。
所有的孫女孫子輩都在那。

sentences.english: I learned politics from Sun Tzu, sooooo, him.
sentences.chinese: 孫子讓我學會了政治，所以，挺他。

sentences.english: So his not-so-great grandson could get in?
sentences.chinese: 所以他的不肖的曾孫子就可以進去？

sentences.english: She has a grown-up son, several grandchildren and lives in Cambridge.
sentences.chinese: 她有一個成年的兒子，孫子和幾個在劍橋的生活。

sentences.english: The old woman told him that she had two grandsons at the front.
sentences.chinese: 老太太告訴他說，前線上有她兩個孫子。

sentences.english: Mr. Wei panic, and he suspected grandson swallowed another cell.
sentences.chinese: 魏先生慌了，他懷疑是孫子吞了另一節電池。

sentences.english: Tosun tzu, war is a matter of life and death. This is the key principle of histeachings.
sentences.chinese: 孫子認爲戰爭關乎生死，這是他所提倡的關鍵原則。

sentences.english: They set up a family trust for their grandchildren.
sentences.chinese: 他們爲其孫子孫女成立了家庭托拉斯。

sentences.english: It's said she’d been trapped in her kitchen with her grandson for nine days.
sentences.chinese: 據信，她和自己的孫子被困在廚房中長達九天的時間。

sentences.english: Sun Tzu’s military mind knew this well.
sentences.chinese: 孫子的軍事思想對此體會尤深。

sentences.english: Granny Wang she finished telling the story to her grandson.
sentences.chinese: 王奶奶給孫子講完故事才睡覺。

sentences.english: The old man hobbled along with the help of his grandson.
sentences.chinese: 老人在他的孫子挽扶下蹣跚而行。

sentences.english: Even the little grandchildren couldn't wait to tell Dad why they loved him.
sentences.chinese: 就連小孫子也迫不及待地要告訴爸爸他們爲什麼愛他。

definition: daughter-in-law/wife (of a younger man)/young married woman/young woman
to look after/to take into consideration/to attend to
we or us (including both the speaker and the person(s) spoken to)/(dialect) I or me/(dialect) (in a coaxing or familiar way) you/also pr. [za2 men5]
